solution.text:
Percentage of her money she spent on a dress = _{j}_ %
Percentage of her money she spent on a dress = _{{60-j}}_%
Since, sum of total percentage = 100
Hence, Percentage of her money she has remaining = 100-_{j}_-_{{60-j}}_% = 40 %
So, 36 rupees = 40 % of initial money or 36 = \(\frac{40}{100} \times \) (initial money)
Initial money = \( 36 \times \frac{100}{40} = 90\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, Megha's initial money = Rs.90

content.text: If Megha spent _{j}_ % of her initial money on buying a dress and then spent _{{60-j}}_% of her initial money to buy an ice cream. If she has Rs.36 remaining, what was her initial money?
